content: stitches only no ch1 in between slip_stitch to join the round r2 ch3 counts as 1st double_crochet *skip 1dc double_crochet in the next double_crochet* repeat from * to * around the cuff slip_stitch in the top of beginning ch3 r3 ch3 *fpdc bpdc* repeat from * to * around the cuff slip_stitch in the top of the beginning ch3 repeat row 3 about 8-10 times the fpdc will always be worked into the previous fpdc bpdc will always be worked into the previous bpdc -remember i am guessing here as i have not yet tried this out myself just go around until it looks right to you it should taper down narrowing the whole if you want to get real creative with it you could change colors every couple of row but change with the closing slip_stitch so your beginning ch3 is with the new color fasten_off and weave in end repeat for the other sleeve finishing the body s trim with the yarn join in the bottom left corner of the cardigan chain space ch2 counts as first half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in every double_crochet and chain space around until you have reached the beginning ch2 slip_stitch in top of the beginning ch2 fasten_off and weave in ends ©2015 knotty fashions by celeste all rights reserved this document including all its sub-sections has copyrights the sale of garments based on knotty fashions is permitted as long as they are sold as single items or per order further commercial use of the patterns is not permitted we ask that you don t make any changes / additions to the original printed document it has to be clearly stated that the garment is made based on a design from knotty fashions the use of knotty fashions photos for marketing purposes/sales is not permitted the use of clothes label must include the following text a knotty fashions design made by … any free patterns must be linked back to knotty fashions i reserve the right to withdraw the permission for use at any time notwithstanding the reason
